thread.title: 'Long Overdue' Meeting Tentatively Scheduled Between Trump, Kasich
thread.title_full: 'Long Overdue' Meeting Tentatively Scheduled Between Trump, Kasich

author: Fred Maxwell
title: 'Long Overdue' Meeting Tentatively Scheduled Between Trump, Kasich
text:
Video Shows The Moment When A Fallen Soldier Makes It Home 
Kasich’s disapproval of Trump was so strong he boycotted the Republican National Convention, held in his home state of Ohio, and wrote-in Arizona Sen. John McCain for his choice for president in the election. 
Although Kasich remained critical of the president after the election, he told ABC News White House correspondent Jon Karl that he disagreed with those who were protesting Trump’s election. 
“I would never try and tell them get off the streets or anything like that, but we need to be together. The people of this country have spoken,” Kasich said. “Give him a chance and there’ll be places where I agree with him and where I disagree with him, but that doesn’t lead to any disrespect. That’s one of the things that’s really important.” 
Kasich attended the Munich Security Conference in Germany over the weekend where he was critical of Trump’s ongoing attack on the media along with the administration’s policies toward its European Union allies. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
